message.content:
cs.SI, cs.SOC, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.DS

The paper deals with opinion maximization in social networks, which is a topic that falls under the intersection of social networks and artificial intelligence. Therefore, cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) and cs.SOC (Computational Social Science) are the most likely categories. The paper also uses a dynamic Bayesian network to model social interactions and evolution of opinions, which falls under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). Finally, the paper proposes learning algorithms to obtain approximate solutions, which falls under cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms).
